description: Before chillies arrived from South America, cooks used long pepper. It can still be found from specialist spice suppliers. Be bold – as the cream takes a lot of the heat out of the spice.

default: 1 x 250ml pot of cream (or crème fraiche)
1 vanilla pod, seeds scraped from the pod
5 long pepper spikes, snapped, cracked and ground

steps: Whisk the cream until soft peaks form. Mix the spices and vanilla seeds together.
Just before serving, fold the spice mixture into the cream, reserving a little to sprinkle on top for aroma.
Dust with icing sugar, particularly if serving the cream with tart fruit such as plums or cherries.
Serve with summer fruits, peaches, nectarines, plums and/or cherries.
title: Fruit salad with long pepper cream
